data.title: Snell-Descartes laws of refraction
data.solution:
import math

n1, n2 = [float(k) for k in input().split()]
i1 = int(input())

if math.sin(math.radians(i1)) <= n2/n1 :
    i2 = int(math.degrees(math.asin(math.sin(math.radians(i1))*n1/n2)))
    print(i2)
else :
    print("No refraction")
data.statement:
A light beam is projected onto a flat surface between two transparent materials with an angle [[i1]] with the normal of this surface. The indices of the two transparent materials are denoted [[n1]] and [[n2]].
Refraction is governed by the Snell-Descartes law : the light ray is refracted if and only if :
sin([[i1]]) <= [[n2]]/[[n1]].
In this case, the angle of the refracted ray with respect to the normal is [[i2]], given by the relation :
[[n1]]×sin([[i1]])=[[n2]]×sin([[i2]]).

<<Goal>> :

Determine if refraction occurs, and if so, give the angle of refraction (in degrees, truncating decimals towards 0. e.g. -2.821 -> -2 and 3.232 -> 3).

(Reminder: 360 degrees = 2*pi radians)

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A light beam is projected onto a flat surface between two transparent materials with an angle i1 with the normal of this surface. The indices of the two transparent materials are denoted n1 and n2.
Refraction is governed by the Snell-Descartes law : the light ray is refracted if and only if :
sin(i1) <= n2/n1.
In this case, the angle of the refracted ray with respect to the normal is i2, given by the relation :
n1×sin(i1)=n2×sin(i2).

Goal :

Determine if refraction occurs, and if so, give the angle of refraction (in degrees, truncating decimals towards 0. e.g. -2.821 -> -2 and 3.232 -> 3).

(Reminder: 360 degrees = 2*pi radians)
Input
Line 1 : n1 n2
Line 2 : i1 the angle of incidence (in degrees)
Output
Line 1 : i2 the angle of refraction (in degrees, truncated towards 0) if refraction, No refraction else.
Constraints
1 ≤ n1
1 ≤ n2
-90 < i1 < 90
-90 < i2 < 90
Example
Input
1 2
70
Output
28
